contentrichtext.text: '''Hillel ben Naphtali Zevi''' was a Lithuanian [[rabbi]]. ==Biography== He was born at [[Brest-Litovsk]] in 1615; died at [[Zolkiev]] January 3, 1690. After he had studied under [[Hirsh Darshan]], Hillel went to [[Vilnius|Vilna]], where from 1650 to 1651 he was a member of the [[rabbinical]] college. He stayed at Wilna until 1666, then became rabbi in [[Kėdainiai]] and several other [[Lithuania]]n towns, was called in 1670 as rabbi to [[Altona, Hamburg|Altona]] and [[Hamburg]], and in 1680 to Zolkiev. He was also a delegate to the [[Council of the Four Lands]] at the fair of [[Yaroslav]]. Hillel was the author of an important work entitled ''Bet Hillel,'' a commentary and ''[[novella|novellæ]]'' on the four parts of the ''[[Shulkhan Arukh]]'', an important code of [[halakha|Jewish law]]. His son, [[Moses ben Hillel]], published only the portions on ''Yoreh De'ah'' and ''Eben ha-Ezer'', with the text (Dyhernfurth, 1691).
